Conclusion Question: Considering one pen equals 'p', calculate the expression representing the sum (in terms of p) of the quantity of red and black pens acquired altogether. direct_answer.text: Considering condition 1 which states that 2,937,405 packs of red pens ('r') are purchased, we can denote r=2,937,405. According to condition 2, twice as many packs of black pens ('b') compared to red pens means b=2*r. Therefore, since every pack contains one unit of pens identified by 'p', you would replace 'r' and 'b' into their respective quantities based on these relations. This yields b=(2)(2,937,405)*(p). Hence, adding together both types of pens results in Total Pen Quantity represented algebraically as T=r+b which simplifies down to T=(2,937,405)+((2*(2,937,405))*p), fulfilling all instructions outlined above while maintaining correct usage of parentheses denoting operational hierarchy per standard conventions of mathematics symbolic expressions.
